[[Category:Monsters]] {| style="background:#f5faff; border:1px solid #cedff2; width:auto; margin: 0px 5%; margin-bottom:1.25em; font-style:italic; text-align:left; color:#000; padding:1.5em 1em;" |- | | style="width: 100%;" | This deep elf is a servant of the ancient dark god of the deep elves, and has been granted command of torturous energies by its enigmatic lord. |} [[Category:Templates]] ==Useful Info== '''Deep elf priests''' are fragile [[list of deep elves|deep elf]] worshipers of a [[god]] of death. When they aren't pelting you with [[Necromancy]] or raising the dead, they can also heal their allies. They are found in packs of deep elves most often in the [[Elven Halls]], [[the Vaults]], and some [[bailey]]s. ==Spells== [[Category:Spellcaster]]
{| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0; width:28em;" ! colspan="3" style="font-size:larger;" | Spell set I |- ! align="left" | Slot1 | [[Pain]] (d14) | [[Spell slot flags|Priest flag]] |- ! align="left" | Slot2 | [[Malign Offering]] (2d13) | [[Spell slot flags|Priest flag]] |- ! align="left" | Slot3 | [[Smiting]] (7-17) | [[Spell slot flags|Priest flag]] |- ! align="left" | Slot4 | [[Twisted Resurrection]] | [[Spell slot flags|Priest flag]] |- |}
==Tips & Tricks== Deep elf priests are far from the deadliest opponents in the Elven Halls, but they should still merit a high priority. Letting them [[smite]] you or use your HP to heal their allies through Malign Offering can be aggravating, and killing other foes first just gives them fuel for [[Twisted Resurrection]]. ==History== Deep elf priests were removed in [[0.18]]. Prior to [[0.13]], they had [[Minor Healing]] but lacked Malign Offering. Prior to the introduction of monster Twisted Resurrection, they simply had [[Animate Dead]]. [[category:Elf]]
